snippet: In Greenpoint, Brooklyn, some residents want the city to enforce an obscure law barring sidewalk tables at cafes on Sunday mornings, citing the need for ample walking space.
abstract: Some residents of Greenpoint, Brooklyn, want New York City to enforce an obscure city law banning outdoor cafe tables before noon on Sundays, citing the need for more walking space for those strolling to church on Sunday mornings; neighborhood is struggling with cultural clashes as gentrification escalates.
lead_paragraph: In Greenpoint, Brooklyn, some residents want the city to enforce an obscure law barring sidewalk tables at cafes on Sunday mornings, citing the need for ample walking space.

headline.seo: Rituals Clash in Brooklyn: Outdoor Cafes Vs. Churchgoers
headline.main: As Greenpoint Gentrifies, Sunday Rituals Clash: Outdoor Cafes vs. Churchgoers
headline.print_headline: As Greenpoint Gentrifies, Sunday Rituals Clash: Outdoor Cafes vs. Churchgoers
